paper.paper_name: SEE In-Flight Data for Two Static 32KB Memories on High Earth Orbit
paper.objective: The main objective of the paper is to present the detailed analysis of in-flight data obtained from two 32KB SRAMs in the MPTB orbit, focusing on the performance, reliability, and survivability of these devices in the space radiation environment over a four-year period.

parts.other_details: Entirely tested using Ram Static Test method. Exhibited stuck bits during solar events.

seeData.energy_levels: Proton Threshold: 10 MeV, Heavy Ion Threshold: 1.7 MeV/mg.cm²
seeData.environmental_conditions: High latitude and altitude, during solar events
seeData.special_notes: Stuck bits correlated to solar events indicating heavy ions presence

tidData.energy_levels: Proton Threshold: 10 MeV, Heavy Ion Threshold: 1.7 MeV/mg.cm²
tidData.environmental_conditions: High latitude and altitude, during solar events
tidData.failing_time: Few hours to almost a month
tidData.special_notes: Stuck bits correlated to solar events indicating heavy ions presence

parts.other_details: Partly tested using both Cyclic Redundancy Checksum and Ram Static Test methods. Used for storage of T225 process workspaces and data.

seeData.energy_levels: Proton Threshold: 5 MeV, Heavy Ion Threshold: 0.1 MeV/mg.cm²
seeData.environmental_conditions: High latitude and altitude, during solar events
seeData.special_notes: SEU rate increases during solar events, indicating heavy ion presence

seeData.energy_levels: Proton Threshold: 5 MeV, Heavy Ion Threshold: 0.1 MeV/mg.cm²
seeData.environmental_conditions: High latitude and altitude, during solar events
seeData.special_notes: SEU rate increases during solar events, indicating heavy ion presence
